title: FBI investigating as hate crime vandalism of Peyton home with racial slurs, feces
text:
The FBI is investigating the Sunday vandalism of a home in Peyton as a hate crime and is looking for the people responsible for smearing dog feces across a couple’s garage, peppering the home with about 40 eggs, and posting about 50 hate messages and racial slurs.
No suspects have yet been identified, FBI Detective Greg Young said Monday. He refused to give any details about the case.
The homeowner declined to talk with The Gazette Monday, asking for privacy. The man, who previously talked with Gazette news partner KKTV, said the incident was frightening and he had no idea why his family was targeted.
The Council on American-Islamic Relations, the nation’s largest Muslim civil rights and advocacy organization, said their headquarters in Washington, D.C. “has noted an unprecedented spike in hate incidents targeting Muslims and other minority groups since the Nov. 8 election.” A soon-to-be published CAIR report on Islamophobia in America also is expected to show that 2016 was the worst year on record for incidents in which mosques were targets of bias.

Incidents of “biased motivated crimes” handled by the El Paso County Sheriff’s Office have gone down in the past three years, according to statistics provided by the office. In 2015, deputies handled six cases, involving theft, tampering, harassment and criminal mischief, the office said. In 2016, there were two cases of criminal mischief, and so far in 2017 there has only been the lone case of criminal mischief, the office said.
